Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Scarab
Description: This bead is pierced longitudinally to allow for its suspension. Its recto is in the likeness of a scarab, while the reverse is adorned with circular geometric motifs. The same motif (two concentric circles) is repeated five times and its regular shape indicates that it was impressed with a stamp.
